meanings.definition: To turn a ship to the right
meanings.sent1: The captain starboarded the ship to avoid the storm.
meanings.sent2: The sailors starboarded the vessel as they approached the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The ship starboarded so quickly that the seagulls were caught off guard.
meanings.sent4: The decision to starboard the ship led them to calmer waters.
meanings.sent5: With a firm hand on the wheel, the captain starboarded the massive ship effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To move to the right side of a ship
meanings.sent1: The crew starboarded to distribute the weight evenly.
meanings.sent2: Passengers starboarded the cruise ship excitedly for their vacation.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat starboarded the ship, looking for fish to chase.
meanings.sent4: She starboarded swiftly, eager to catch a glimpse of the dolphins.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the travelers starboarded to enjoy the view of the coastline.
